title: Monopolistic competition in the long run

content.question: Which of the following is true about price <math alttext="(P)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>P</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, marginal cost <math alttext="(M C)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, marginal revenue <math alttext="(M R)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and economic profit of a monopolistically competitive firm in long-run equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="P is greater than M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>></mo><mi>MC</mi></math>; Marginal revenue is below demand; Economic profit is zero

<math alttext="P is less than M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo> </mo><mo><</mo><mo> </mo><mi>MC</mi></math>; Marginal revenue is below demand; Economic profit is positive

<math alttext="P is greater than M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo> </mo><mo>></mo><mi>MC</mi></math>; Marginal revenue is above demand; Economic profit is positive

<math alttext="P equals M R, which equals M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mi>MR</mi><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mi>MC</mi></math>; Marginal revenue is equal to demand; Economic profit is zero

<math alttext="P equals M R, which equals M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><mi>MR</mi><mo> </mo><mo>=</mo><mi>MC</mi></math>; Marginal revenue is above demand; Economic profit is positive

content.answer: <math alttext="P is greater than M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>></mo><mi>MC</mi></math>; Marginal revenue is below demand; Economic profit is zero

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe economic concepts, principles, or models.
